instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2: What is SMC_PM_G2? This is a typo of SMC_PM_G2_EN When you see SMC_PM_G2, assume they meant to type SMC_PM_G2_EN.
definitions.P5VS5_EN: What is P5VS5_EN? P5VS5_EN is a signal that turns on the PP5V_S5 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Im working on a board that has green light but no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>. Am i correct in thinking <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 12 ~(<SIGNAL>P5VS5_EN</SIGNAL>) needs to be present for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> to be on pin 29.?.
<SIGNAL>P5VS5_EN</SIGNAL> seems to be from <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2</SIGNAL> presented on <RESISTOR>R8140</RESISTOR> which reads 0v (100ohms), there does not seem to be a short on either side of this resistor (0.524 diode reading).

SMc issue or is my thinking wrong?.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
pp3v43 = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is required to enable LDO outputs.
Try reballing SMC first; if no result, change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Strange thing happened. I reballed the SMC and fitted properly (tripled checked alignment and placement). After that <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> returned and current shot up to 300ma. Now there a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3S_5</SIGNAL> L7560 on pin 1.  Also short on L7630 also so I think the PCh/Cpu is bad . Is there a known issue with these boards and CPU/PCh  dying? This is the 3rd one of these over the last few weeks with dead Cpu/Pch.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Both voltages go to PCH, so is dead probably.
You can inject voltage on 3V3 and check if PCH heats up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Is this model particularly known for cpu pch dying? as its the 3rd one if a few weeks same mobo number all with dead cpu/pch

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I don't think.
Personally didn't faced that...

Did you have short before replacing SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Not on this latest one , I removed the smc but short still there  the other 2 came in with shorts on pch side of L7630
